sentences.zh: 高祖，沛豐邑中陽里人也，姓劉氏。

translations.literal: Gaozu was a person from Zhongyang Village, Fengyi Town, Pei County, and his surname was Liu.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was a native of Zhongyang Village in Fengyi Township, Pei County, and bore the surname Liu.

sentences.zh: 母媼嘗息大澤之陂，夢與神遇。

translations.literal: His mother the old woman once rested by the dike of a great marsh, and dreamed that she encountered a god.
translations.idiomatic: His mother once rested by the bank of a vast marsh and dreamed of meeting a divine being.

sentences.zh: 是時雷電晦冥，父太公往視，則見交龍於上。

translations.literal: At this time there was thunder and lightning, dark and obscure; his father Taigong went to look, and then saw two dragons copulating above.
translations.idiomatic: At that moment, thunder crashed and lightning flashed in the darkened sky. His father Taigong went to investigate and saw two dragons entwined overhead.

sentences.zh: 已而有娠，遂產高祖。

translations.literal: Soon after she became pregnant, and then gave birth to Gaozu.
translations.idiomatic: Soon she conceived and gave birth to Gaozu.

translations.literal: Gaozu was a native of Zhongyang Village in Fengyi Township, Pei County, and bore the surname Liu. His mother once rested by the bank of a vast marsh and dreamed of meeting a divine being. At that moment, thunder crashed and lightning flashed in the darkened sky. His father Taigong went to investigate and saw two dragons entwined overhead. Soon she conceived and gave birth to Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 高祖為人，隆準而龍顏，美須髯，左股有七十二黑子。

translations.literal: Gaozu as a person had a high nose and dragon-like face, beautiful beard and whiskers, and on his left thigh there were seventy-two black moles.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu had a prominent nose, a face like a dragon, magnificent whiskers, and seventy-two black moles on his left thigh.

sentences.zh: 寬仁愛人，意豁如也。

translations.literal: He was magnanimous, benevolent, and loved people; his thoughts were open and clear.
translations.idiomatic: He was generous, kind, and loved others, with an open and magnanimous spirit.

sentences.zh: 常有大度，不事家人生產作 業。

translations.literal: He constantly had great breadth of mind, did not engage in the household production occupations.
translations.idiomatic: He always showed great magnanimity and never bothered with household chores or farming.

sentences.zh: 及壯，試吏，為泗上亭長，廷中吏無所不狎侮。

translations.literal: When he reached adulthood, he tried being an official, became the pavilion chief of Sishang, and among the officials in the court there was none he did not treat familiarly and insult.
translations.idiomatic: Upon reaching adulthood, he became a minor official, serving as the chief of a rural pavilion. Among the court officials, there was none he didn't treat with casual familiarity and mock.

sentences.zh: 好酒及色。

translations.literal: He was fond of wine and sex.
translations.idiomatic: He loved wine and women.

sentences.zh: 常從王媼、武負貰酒，時飲醉臥，武負、王媼見其上常有怪。

translations.literal: He often borrowed wine from Wang Ao and Wu Fu; at times he drank until drunk and lay down, and Wu Fu and Wang Ao saw that above him there was often something strange.
translations.idiomatic: He frequently borrowed wine from Granny Wang and Wu Fu. Sometimes he'd drink himself into a stupor and collapse, and both Wu Fu and Granny Wang noticed strange apparitions hovering above him.

sentences.zh: 高祖每酤留飲，酒讎數倍。

translations.literal: Gaozu every time he bought wine would keep drinking, the wine debts several times.
translations.idiomatic: Whenever Gaozu bought wine, he'd stay and drink, racking up debts several times the amount.

sentences.zh: 及見怪，歲 竟，此兩家常折券棄責。

translations.literal: When they saw the strange thing, the year ended, these two families constantly tore up the bonds and abandoned the debts.
translations.idiomatic: When they witnessed the strange phenomenon, at year's end these two families would tear up the IOUs and forgive the debts.

He was generous, kind, and loved others, with an open and magnanimous spirit. He always showed great magnanimity and never bothered with household chores or farming. Upon reaching adulthood, he became a minor official, serving as the chief of a rural pavilion. Among the court officials, there was none he didn't treat with casual familiarity and mock. When they witnessed the strange phenomenon, at year's end these two families would tear up the IOUs and forgive the debts.

sentences.zh: 高祖常繇咸陽，縱觀秦皇帝，喟然大息，曰：「嗟乎，大丈夫當如此矣！」

translations.literal: Gaozu often passed through Xianyang, gazed freely at the Qin emperor, sighed deeply, said: 'Alas, a great man should be like this!'
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu often passed through Xianyang and gazed at the Qin emperor. He sighed deeply and said, 'Ah, this is how a true man should live!'

sentences.zh: 單父人呂公善沛令，辟仇，從之客，因家焉。

translations.literal: The Shanfu person Lü Gong was on good terms with the Pei magistrate, avoided enmity, followed him as guest, and therefore settled his family there.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong from Shanfu was friends with the magistrate of Pei. To avoid his enemies, he became the magistrate's guest and settled his family there.

sentences.zh: 沛中豪傑吏聞令有重客，皆往賀。

translations.literal: The Pei middle heroes and officials heard the magistrate had an important guest, all went to congratulate.
translations.idiomatic: When Pei's elite officials heard the magistrate had an important guest, they all went to offer congratulations.

sentences.zh: 蕭何為主吏，主進，令諸 大夫曰：「進不滿千錢，坐之堂下。」

translations.literal: Xiao He was the chief clerk, in charge of receiving guests, ordered the various grandees saying: 'Gifts not reaching a thousand cash, seat them below the hall.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He served as chief clerk handling receptions. He instructed the other officials: 'Anyone whose gift is less than a thousand cash must sit below the main hall.'

sentences.zh: 高祖為亭長，素易諸吏，乃紿為謁曰「賀錢萬」，實不持一錢。

translations.literal: Gaozu was the pavilion chief, usually treated the various officials casually, then deceived them by announcing 'Congratulations money ten thousand', actually did not bring one cash.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was the local sheriff and usually treated officials casually. He tricked them by announcing 'Ten thousand cash congratulations gift' but actually brought nothing.

sentences.zh: 謁入，呂公大驚，起，迎之門。

translations.literal: The announcement entered, Lü Gong greatly astonished, rose, welcomed him at the gate.
translations.idiomatic: When the announcement came in, Lü Gong was astonished. He rose and went to welcome Gaozu at the gate.

sentences.zh: 呂公者，好相人，見高祖狀 貌，因重敬之，引入坐上坐。

translations.literal: Lü Gong was fond of physiognomy, saw Gaozu's appearance and bearing, therefore greatly respected him, led him in to sit in the seat of honor.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong loved reading faces. When he saw Gaozu's features, he was greatly impressed and seated him in the place of honor.

sentences.zh: 蕭何曰：「劉季固多大言，少成事。」

translations.literal: Xiao He said: 'Liu Ji indeed much big talk, little accomplishes things.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He said, 'Liu Ji talks big but accomplishes little.'

sentences.zh: 高祖因狎侮諸客，遂坐上坐，無所詘。

translations.literal: Gaozu because of familiarly insulting the various guests, then sat in the seat of honor, and was not at all yielding.
translations.idiomatic: Because he treated all the guests with casual familiarity and mockery, Gaozu ended up taking the seat of honor without yielding to anyone.

sentences.zh: 酒闌，呂公因目固留高祖。

translations.literal: When the wine was exhausted, Lü Gong therefore gave a meaningful glance and firmly detained Gaozu.
translations.idiomatic: As the banquet wound down, Lü Gong exchanged glances and insisted on keeping Gaozu behind.

sentences.zh: 竟酒，後。

translations.literal: They finished the wine, afterwards.
translations.idiomatic: They finished drinking, and afterward...

sentences.zh: 呂公曰：「臣少好 相人，相人多矣，無如季相，願季自愛。

translations.literal: Lü Gong said: 'I from youth have liked physiognomy, have read physiognomy for many people, none are like Ji's physiognomy, I hope Ji will take care of himself.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong said, 'Since I was young, I've loved reading faces. I've analyzed countless people, but none have the remarkable features of Ji. I hope you'll take good care of yourself.

sentences.zh: 臣有息女，願為箕帚妾。」

translations.literal: I have a young daughter, I wish her to be Ji's broom and mat concubine.'
translations.idiomatic: I have a young daughter whom I would like to offer as your humble wife.'

sentences.zh: 酒罷，呂媼怒呂公曰：「公始常欲奇此女，與貴人。

translations.literal: When the wine was finished, Lü Ao was angry at Lü Gong and said: 'You at first constantly wanted to make this girl exceptional, and give her to a noble person.
translations.idiomatic: After the banquet ended, Lü Ao angrily confronted Lü Gong: 'You always wanted to treat this girl specially and marry her to someone noble.

sentences.zh: 沛令善公，求之不與，何自妄許與劉季？」

translations.literal: The Pei magistrate was on good terms with you, sought her and you didn't give, why arbitrarily promise her to Liu Ji?'
translations.idiomatic: The magistrate of Pei was your good friend and asked for her hand, but you refused. Why arbitrarily promise her to Liu Ji?'

sentences.zh: 呂公曰：「此非兒女子所知。」

translations.literal: Lü Gong said: 'This is not something that women and children know.'
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong replied, 'This is not something women and children understand.'

sentences.zh: 卒與高祖。

translations.literal: In the end he gave her to Gaozu.
translations.idiomatic: In the end, she was married to Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 呂公女即呂后也，生孝惠帝、魯元公主。

translations.literal: Lü Gong's daughter was namely Empress Lü, she gave birth to Emperor Xiaohui and Princess Lu Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong's daughter became Empress Lü, and she bore Emperor Xiaohui and Princess Lu Yuan.

translations.literal: Lü Gong from Shanfu was friends with the magistrate of Pei. To avoid his enemies, he became the magistrate's guest and settled his family there. When Pei's elite officials heard the magistrate had an important guest, they all went to offer congratulations. Xiao He served as chief clerk handling receptions. He instructed the other officials: 'Anyone whose gift is less than a thousand cash must sit below the main hall.' Gaozu was the local sheriff and usually treated officials casually. He tricked them by announcing 'Ten thousand cash congratulations gift' but actually brought nothing. When the announcement came in, Lü Gong was astonished. He rose and went to welcome Gaozu at the gate. Lü Gong loved reading faces. When he saw Gaozu's features, he was greatly impressed and seated him in the place of honor. Xiao He said, 'Liu Ji talks big but accomplishes little.' Because he treated all the guests with casual familiarity and mockery, Gaozu ended up taking the seat of honor without yielding to anyone. As the banquet wound down, Lü Gong exchanged glances and insisted on keeping Gaozu behind. They finished drinking, and afterward... Lü Gong said, 'Since I was young, I've loved reading faces. I've analyzed countless people, but none have the remarkable features of Ji. I hope you'll take good care of yourself. I have a young daughter whom I would like to offer as your humble wife.' After the banquet ended, Lü Ao angrily confronted Lü Gong: 'You always wanted to treat this girl specially and marry her to someone noble. The magistrate of Pei was your good friend and asked for her hand, but you refused. Why arbitrarily promise her to Liu Ji?' Lü Gong replied, 'This is not something women and children understand.' In the end, she was married to Gaozu. Lü Gong's daughter became Empress Lü, and she bore Emperor Xiaohui and Princess Lu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 高祖嘗告歸之田。

translations.literal: Gaozu once took leave and returned to the fields.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu once took leave to return to his farm.

sentences.zh: 呂后與兩子居田中，有一老父過請飲，呂后因餔之。

translations.literal: Empress Lü and her two children lived in the fields, there was an old man who passed by requesting drink, Empress Lü therefore fed him.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü lived in the countryside with her two children. One day an old man passed by asking for a drink, and she fed him.

sentences.zh: 老父相后曰：「夫人天下貴人 也。」

translations.literal: The old man read Empress Lü's physiognomy and said: 'Madam is a noble person of the realm.'
translations.idiomatic: The old man read Empress Lü's face and said, 'Madam, you will be the most noble woman in the empire.'

sentences.zh: 令相兩子，見孝惠帝，曰：「夫人所以貴者，乃此男也。」

translations.literal: He had him read the physiognomy of the two children, seeing Emperor Xiaohui, he said: 'The reason madam will be noble is this boy.'
translations.idiomatic: He then read the faces of her two children. Looking at Emperor Xiaohui, he said, 'The reason you will be noble, madam, is this boy.'

sentences.zh: 相魯元公主，亦皆貴。

translations.literal: Reading Princess Lu Yuan's physiognomy, also all noble.
translations.idiomatic: When he read Princess Lu Yuan's face, he said she too would be noble.

sentences.zh: 老父已去，高祖適從旁舍來，呂后具言客有過，相我子母皆大貴。

translations.literal: The old man had already left, Gaozu just then came from the neighboring shed, Empress Lü fully told him that a guest had passed by, who read physiognomy for me and my children, saying we would all be greatly noble.
translations.idiomatic: The old man had already departed when Gaozu returned from the neighboring cottage. Empress Lü told him everything about the visitor who had read their faces and predicted great nobility for them all.

sentences.zh: 高祖問， 曰：「未遠。」

translations.literal: Gaozu asked, said: 'Not far.'
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu asked where he had gone. 'Not far,' she replied.

sentences.zh: 乃追及，問老父。

translations.literal: Then he pursued and caught up, questioned the old man.
translations.idiomatic: He went after him and caught up, then questioned the old man.

sentences.zh: 老父曰：「鄉者夫人兒子皆以君，君相貴不可言。」

translations.literal: The old man said: 'Just now madam's children all take after you, your lordship's physiognomy is noble beyond words.'
translations.idiomatic: The old man said, 'Just now I saw that your children all resemble you, my lord. Your features indicate nobility beyond description.'

sentences.zh: 高祖乃謝曰：「誠如父言，不敢忘德。」

translations.literal: Gaozu then thanked him saying: 'Truly as father says, I dare not forget the favor.'
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu thanked him profusely: 'Your words are truly prophetic, sir. I won't forget your kindness.'

sentences.zh: 及高祖貴，遂不知老父處。

translations.literal: When Gaozu became noble, then he did not know the old man's whereabouts.
translations.idiomatic: After Gaozu rose to power, he lost track of where the old man had gone.

translations.literal: Gaozu once took leave to return to his farm. Empress Lü lived in the countryside with her two children. One day an old man passed by asking for a drink, and she fed him. The old man read Empress Lü's face and said, 'Madam, you will be the most noble woman in the empire.' He then read the faces of her two children. Looking at Emperor Xiaohui, he said, 'The reason you will be noble, madam, is this boy.' When he read Princess Lu Yuan's face, he said she too would be noble. The old man had already departed when Gaozu returned from the neighboring cottage. Empress Lü told him everything about the visitor who had read their faces and predicted great nobility for them all. Gaozu asked where he had gone. 'Not far,' she replied. He went after him and caught up, then questioned the old man. The old man said, 'Just now I saw that your children all resemble you, my lord. Your features indicate nobility beyond description.' Gaozu thanked him profusely: 'Your words are truly prophetic, sir. I won't forget your kindness.' After Gaozu rose to power, he lost track of where the old man had gone.

translations.literal: Gaozu as pavilion chief, then made a crown from bamboo skin, had the thief-catching Xue make it, wore it from time to time, and when noble constantly wore it, what is called 'Liu clan crown'.
translations.idiomatic: When Gaozu was a local sheriff, he had a crown made from bamboo bark and asked Xue, the thief-catcher, to make it. He wore it occasionally then, and continued wearing it after becoming emperor. This became known as the 'Liu family crown.'

translations.idiomatic: You gentlemen go your way. I'll disappear from here too!'

sentences.zh: 徒中壯士願從諸十餘人。

translations.literal: Among the convicts there were sturdy warriors who wished to follow him, more than ten people.
translations.idiomatic: Among the convicts were over a dozen strong men who wanted to follow him.

translations.literal: Gaozu was drunk, at night he went directly through the marsh, ordered one person to walk ahead.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was drunk and walking through the marsh at night when he sent one man ahead to scout.

translations.literal: Ahead there is a large snake blocking the path, I wish to return.'
translations.idiomatic: There's a huge snake blocking the path ahead. I want to turn back.'

sentences.zh: 高祖醉，曰：「壯士行，何畏！」

translations.literal: Gaozu drunk, said: 'A warrior walks, what is there to fear!'
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu, still drunk, said, 'A real man keeps going! What's there to fear?'

sentences.zh: 乃前，拔劍斬蛇。

translations.literal: Then he went forward, drew his sword and cut the snake.
translations.idiomatic: He went forward, drew his sword, and slashed the snake in two.

sentences.zh: 蛇分為兩，道開。

translations.literal: The snake divided into two, the path opened.
translations.idiomatic: The snake split in two, clearing the path.

sentences.zh: 行數里， 醉困臥。

translations.literal: They walked several li, drunk and tired he lay down.
translations.idiomatic: They walked a few miles before Gaozu, exhausted and still drunk, collapsed and fell asleep.

sentences.zh: 後人來至蛇所，有一老嫗夜哭。

translations.literal: Later people came to the snake's location, there was an old woman crying at night.
translations.idiomatic: Later, when people came to where the snake had been, they found an old woman crying in the night.

sentences.zh: 人問嫗何哭，嫗曰：「人殺吾子。」

translations.literal: People asked the old woman why she cried, the old woman said: 'Someone killed my son.'
translations.idiomatic: Someone asked the old woman why she was crying. 'A man killed my son,' she replied.

sentences.zh: 人曰：「嫗子何為見殺？」

translations.literal: People said: 'Old woman's son why was he killed?'
translations.idiomatic: They asked, 'How did your son get killed?'

sentences.zh: 嫗曰：「吾子，白帝子也，化為蛇，當道，今者赤帝子斬 之，故哭。」

translations.literal: The old woman said: 'My son is the son of the White Emperor, transformed into a snake, blocked the path, now the son of the Red Emperor cut it, therefore I cry.'
translations.idiomatic: The old woman said, 'My son was the child of the White Emperor. He transformed into a snake to block the path, but now the child of the Red Emperor has slain him. That's why I'm crying.'

sentences.zh: 人乃以嫗為不誠，欲苦之，嫗因忽不見。

translations.literal: People then took the old woman as not sincere, wanted to harm her, the old woman therefore suddenly disappeared.
translations.idiomatic: The people thought she was lying and wanted to punish her, but she suddenly vanished.

sentences.zh: 後人至，高祖覺。

translations.literal: Later people arrived, Gaozu awoke.
translations.idiomatic: When others arrived later, Gaozu woke up.

translations.literal: They told Gaozu, Gaozu then in his heart alone was happy, considered himself outstanding.
translations.idiomatic: They told Gaozu what happened, and he was secretly delighted, feeling quite pleased with himself.

translations.literal: Qin Shihuang once said 'There is emperor aura in the southeast', therefore he toured east to repress it.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Shihuang once said there was 'imperial aura' in the southeast, so he traveled east to suppress it.

sentences.zh: 高祖隱於芒、碭山澤間，呂后與人俱求，常得之。

translations.literal: Gaozu hid in the mountains and marshes between Mang and Dang, Empress Lü together with people sought him, often found him.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu hid in the mountains and marshes between Mang and Dang counties. Empress Lü searched for him with others and always found him.

sentences.zh: 高祖怪問之。

translations.literal: Gaozu strangely asked about it.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu asked curiously how she always found him.

sentences.zh: 呂后曰：「季所居上常有雲氣，故從往常得季。」

translations.literal: Empress Lü said: 'Above where Ji resides there is often cloud qi, therefore following it I always find Ji.'
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü replied, 'There's always a cloud of auspicious vapor above wherever you hide. I just follow that cloud and it leads me right to you.'

sentences.zh: 高祖又喜。

translations.literal: Gaozu again was happy.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu was pleased once more.

sentences.zh: 沛中子弟或聞之，多欲附者矣。

translations.literal: Pei middle young men some heard of it, many desired to attach themselves.
translations.idiomatic: When some young men from Pei heard about this, many wanted to join him.

sentences.zh: 於是樊噲從高祖來。

translations.literal: Therefore Fan Kuai followed Gaozu and came.
translations.idiomatic: This is when Fan Kuai came to join Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 沛令後悔，恐其有變，乃閉城城守，欲誅蕭、曹。

translations.literal: The Pei magistrate afterwards regretted, feared there would be change, therefore closed the city and defended it, wanted to execute Xiao and Cao.
translations.idiomatic: The magistrate of Pei now regretted his decision. Fearing trouble, he sealed the city gates and prepared to execute Xiao He and Cao Shen.

sentences.zh: 蕭、曹恐，踰城保高祖。

translations.literal: Xiao and Cao were afraid, climbed over the wall to protect Gaozu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He and Cao Shen, terrified, climbed over the city wall to join Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 高祖乃書 帛射城上，與沛父老曰：「天下同苦秦久矣。

translations.literal: Gaozu then wrote on silk and shot it onto the city wall, telling the Pei elders: 'The realm together has suffered under Qin for a long time.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu wrote a message on silk, shot it over the city wall, and addressed the elders of Pei: 'All under heaven have suffered long under Qin tyranny.

sentences.zh: 今父老雖為沛令守，諸侯並起，今屠沛。

translations.literal: Now although elders defend for the Pei magistrate, the feudal lords all rise, now they will slaughter Pei.
translations.idiomatic: Though you defend the magistrate now, the other lords are rising up. They'll slaughter everyone in Pei.

sentences.zh: 沛今共誅令，擇可立立之，以應諸侯，即室家完。

translations.literal: Pei now together execute the magistrate, choose someone suitable to establish, to respond to the feudal lords, then families will be complete.
translations.idiomatic: If Pei executes the magistrate together and chooses a worthy leader to join the other lords, your families will be safe.

sentences.zh: 不然，父子俱屠，無為 也。」

translations.literal: If not, fathers and sons will all be slaughtered, useless.'
translations.idiomatic: Otherwise, we'll all be massacred—fathers, sons, everyone. There's no point in that.'

sentences.zh: 父老乃帥子弟共殺沛令，開城門迎高祖，欲以為沛令。

translations.literal: The elders then led their young men together to kill the Pei magistrate, opened the city gates to welcome Gaozu, wished to make him Pei magistrate.
translations.idiomatic: The elders rallied their sons and young men, killed the magistrate, opened the gates, and welcomed Gaozu, wanting to make him magistrate of Pei.

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「天下方擾，諸侯並起，令置將不善，一敗塗地。

translations.literal: Gaozu said: 'The realm is currently in chaos, feudal lords all rising, appointing generals poorly, one defeat covers the ground.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu said, 'The empire is in turmoil with lords rising everywhere. If I appoint the wrong commanders, one defeat will destroy everything.

sentences.zh: 吾非敢自愛，恐能薄，不能完父兄子弟。

translations.literal: I do not dare to love myself, fear my abilities are thin, cannot protect fathers, elder brothers, younger brothers.
translations.idiomatic: I'm not trying to save myself—I just fear my abilities are limited and I can't protect all our families.'

sentences.zh: 此 大事，願吏擇可者。」

translations.literal: This is a great matter, I wish officials choose the suitable one.'
translations.idiomatic: This is a grave responsibility. Please, officials, choose someone capable.'

sentences.zh: 蕭、曹等皆文吏，自愛，恐事不就，後秦種族其家，盡讓高祖。

translations.literal: Xiao, Cao and others all were civil officials, loved themselves, feared affairs would not succeed, afterwards Qin would exterminate their families, all yielded to Gaozu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He, Cao Shen and the other civil officials, fearing failure and Qin reprisals against their families, all declined and urged Gaozu to take the position.

sentences.zh: 諸父老皆曰：「平生所聞劉季奇怪，當貴，且卜筮之，莫如劉季最吉。」

translations.literal: All the elders said: 'What we have heard in our lives about Liu Ji is strange, he should be noble, moreover divining it, none is as auspicious as Liu Ji.'
translations.idiomatic: All the elders said, 'Throughout our lives we've heard strange tales about Liu Ji. He is destined for greatness. Even divination shows no one more auspicious than Liu Ji.'

sentences.zh: 高祖 數讓。

translations.literal: Gaozu repeatedly declined.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu repeatedly declined the position.

sentences.zh: 眾莫肯為，高祖乃立為沛公。

translations.literal: The crowd none would do it, Gaozu then was established as Pei Lord.
translations.idiomatic: No one else would accept, so Gaozu was established as Lord of Pei.

sentences.zh: 祠黃帝，祭蚩尤於沛廷，而釁鼓旗。

translations.literal: Sacrificed to the Yellow Emperor, offered to Chi You in the Pei court, and smeared the drums and banners with blood.
translations.idiomatic: He sacrificed to the Yellow Emperor and Chi You in the Pei courthouse, then consecrated the drums and banners with blood.

sentences.zh: 幟皆赤，由所殺蛇白帝子，所殺者赤帝子故也。

translations.literal: The banners all were red, because the killed snake was White Emperor's son, the killer was Red Emperor's son therefore.
translations.idiomatic: All banners were red, symbolizing that he who killed the White Emperor's son (the snake) was himself the Red Emperor's son.

sentences.zh: 於是少年豪吏如蕭、曹、樊噲等皆為收沛子 弟，得三千人。

translations.literal: Therefore young heroic officials like Xiao, Cao, Fan Kuai and others all recruited Pei young men, obtained three thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Young officials like Xiao He, Cao Shen, and Fan Kuai recruited three thousand young men from Pei.

translations.literal: This is when Fan Kuai came to join Gaozu. The magistrate of Pei now regretted his decision. Fearing trouble, he sealed the city gates and prepared to execute Xiao He and Cao Shen. Xiao He and Cao Shen, terrified, climbed over the city wall to join Gaozu. Gaozu wrote a message on silk, shot it over the city wall, and addressed the elders of Pei: 'All under heaven have suffered long under Qin tyranny. Though you defend the magistrate now, the other lords are rising up. They'll slaughter everyone in Pei. If Pei executes the magistrate together and chooses a worthy leader to join the other lords, your families will be safe. Otherwise, we'll all be massacred—fathers, sons, everyone. There's no point in that.' The elders rallied their sons and young men, killed the magistrate, opened the gates, and welcomed Gaozu, wanting to make him magistrate of Pei. Gaozu said, 'The empire is in turmoil with lords rising everywhere. If I appoint the wrong commanders, one defeat will destroy everything. I'm not trying to save myself—I just fear my abilities are limited and I can't protect all our families.' This is a grave responsibility. Please, officials, choose someone capable.' Xiao He, Cao Shen and the other civil officials, fearing failure and Qin reprisals against their families, all declined and urged Gaozu to take the position. All the elders said, 'Throughout our lives we've heard strange tales about Liu Ji. He is destined for greatness. Even divination shows no one more auspicious than Liu Ji.' Gaozu repeatedly declined the position. No one else would accept, so Gaozu was established as Lord of Pei. He sacrificed to the Yellow Emperor and Chi You in the Pei courthouse, then consecrated the drums and banners with blood. All banners were red, symbolizing that he who killed the White Emperor's son (the snake) was himself the Red Emperor's son. Young officials like Xiao He, Cao Shen, and Fan Kuai recruited three thousand young men from Pei.

sentences.zh: 是月，項梁與兄子羽起吳。

translations.literal: This month, Xiang Liang and his brother's son Yu rose in Wu.
translations.idiomatic: That month, Xiang Liang and his nephew Xiang Yu rose up in Wu.

sentences.zh: 田儋與從弟榮、橫起齊，自立為齊王。

translations.literal: Tian Dan and his younger cousin Rong, Heng rose in Qi, established themselves as King of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Dan and his cousins Tian Rong and Tian Heng rose up in Qi and proclaimed themselves King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 韓廣自立為燕王。

translations.literal: Han Guang established himself as King of Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Han Guang proclaimed himself King of Yan.

sentences.zh: 魏咎自立為魏王。

translations.literal: Wei Jiu established himself as King of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Jiu proclaimed himself King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 陳涉之將周章西入關，至戲，秦將章邯距破之。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng's general Zhou Zhang entered the passes westward, reached Xi, Qin general Zhang Han resisted and defeated him.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Sheng's general Zhou Zhang marched west through the passes and reached Xi, where Qin general Zhang Han defeated him.

translations.literal: That month, Xiang Liang and his nephew Xiang Yu rose up in Wu. Tian Dan and his cousins Tian Rong and Tian Heng rose up in Qi and proclaimed themselves King of Qi. Han Guang proclaimed himself King of Yan. Wei Jiu proclaimed himself King of Wei. Chen Sheng's general Zhou Zhang marched west through the passes and reached Xi, where Qin general Zhang Han defeated him.

sentences.zh: 秦二年十月，沛公攻胡陵、方與，還守豐。

translations.literal: Qin second year tenth month, Pei Lord attacked Hu Ling and Fang Yu, returned to defend Feng.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of the second year of Qin, Lord Pei attacked Hu Ling and Fang Yu, then returned to defend Feng.

sentences.zh: 秦泗川監平將兵圍豐。

translations.literal: Qin Sishui commandery overseer Ping led troops to surround Feng.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin overseer of Sishui commandery, Ping, led troops to besiege Feng.

sentences.zh: 二日，出與戰，破之。

translations.literal: Two days, went out and fought with them, defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: Two days later, they sallied forth and defeated the besiegers.

sentences.zh: 令雍齒守豐。

translations.literal: Ordered Yong Chi to defend Feng.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered Yong Chi to defend Feng.

sentences.zh: 十 一月，沛公引兵之薜。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Pei Lord led troops to Xi.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Lord Pei led his troops to Xi.

sentences.zh: 秦泗川守壯兵敗於薛，走至戚，沛公左司馬得殺之。

translations.literal: Qin Sishui defender Zhuang's troops were defeated at Xue, fled to Qi, Pei Lord's left marshal captured and killed him.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin defender of Sishui, Zhuang, was defeated at Xue and fled to Qi, where Lord Pei's left marshal captured and executed him.

sentences.zh: 沛公還軍亢父，至方與。

translations.literal: Pei Lord returned his army to Kangfu, arrived at Fangyu.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Pei withdrew his army to Kangfu, then proceeded to Fangyu.

sentences.zh: 趙王武臣為其將所殺。

translations.literal: Zhao King Wu Chen was killed by his general.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu Chen of Zhao was assassinated by one of his generals.

sentences.zh: 十二月，楚王陳涉為其御莊賈所殺。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, Chu King Chen Sheng was killed by his charioteer Zhuang Jia.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, King Chen Sheng of Chu was assassinated by his charioteer Zhuang Jia.

sentences.zh: 魏人 周市略地豐沛，使人謂雍齒曰：「豐，故梁徙也，今魏地已定者數十城。

translations.literal: Wei person Zhou Shi conquered territory Feng Pei, sent person to tell Yong Chi: 'Feng was formerly Liang migrants, now Wei territory already settled several tens cities.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei commander Zhou Shi was conquering territory around Feng and Pei. He sent a messenger to Yong Chi: 'Feng was originally settled by Liang migrants. Wei has now secured dozens of cities in this area.

sentences.zh: 齒今下魏，魏以齒為侯守豐；

translations.literal: Chi now submits to Wei, Wei will make Chi a marquis to guard Feng;
translations.idiomatic: If you submit to Wei now, we'll make you Marquis of Feng and let you defend it.

sentences.zh: 不下，且屠豐。」

translations.literal: If not submit, then will slaughter Feng.'
translations.idiomatic: If you refuse, we'll massacre everyone in Feng.'

sentences.zh: 雍齒雅不欲屬沛公，及魏招之，即反為魏守 豐。

translations.literal: Yong Chi fundamentally did not wish to belong to Pei Lord, when Wei summoned him, immediately rebelled to guard Feng for Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Yong Chi had never wanted to serve Lord Pei anyway. When Wei offered him the deal, he immediately defected and began defending Feng for Wei.

sentences.zh: 沛公攻豐，不能取。

translations.literal: Pei Lord attacked Feng, could not take it.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Pei attacked Feng but couldn't capture it.

sentences.zh: 沛公還之沛，怨雍齒與豐子弟畔之。

translations.literal: Pei Lord returned to Pei, resented Yong Chi and Feng young men rebelling against him.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Pei returned to Pei, resentful that Yong Chi and the young men of Feng had rebelled against him.

translations.literal: In the tenth month of the second year of Qin, Lord Pei attacked Hu Ling and Fang Yu, then returned to defend Feng. The Qin overseer of Sishui commandery, Ping, led troops to besiege Feng. Two days later, they sallied forth and defeated the besiegers. He ordered Yong Chi to defend Feng. In the eleventh month, Lord Pei led his troops to Xi. The Qin defender of Sishui, Zhuang, was defeated at Xue and fled to Qi, where Lord Pei's left marshal captured and executed him. Lord Pei withdrew his army to Kangfu, then proceeded to Fangyu. King Wu Chen of Zhao was assassinated by one of his generals. In the twelfth month, King Chen Sheng of Chu was assassinated by his charioteer Zhuang Jia. The Wei commander Zhou Shi was conquering territory around Feng and Pei. He sent a messenger to Yong Chi: 'Feng was originally settled by Liang migrants. Wei has now secured dozens of cities in this area. If you submit to Wei now, we'll make you Marquis of Feng and let you defend it. If you refuse, we'll massacre everyone in Feng.' Yong Chi had never wanted to serve Lord Pei anyway. When Wei offered him the deal, he immediately defected and began defending Feng for Wei. Lord Pei attacked Feng but couldn't capture it. Lord Pei returned to Pei, resentful that Yong Chi and the young men of Feng had rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 正月，張耳等立趙後趙歇為趙王。

translations.literal: First month, Zhang Er and others established Zhao descendant Zhao Xie as Zhao King.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month, Zhang Er and others installed Zhao Xie, a descendant of the Zhao royal family, as King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 東陽甯君、秦嘉立景駒為楚王，在留。

translations.literal: Dongyang Ning Jun, Qin Jia established Jing Ju as Chu King, located in Liu.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Ning of Dongyang and Qin Jia installed Jing Ju as King of Chu, with his capital at Liu.

sentences.zh: 沛公往從之，道得張良，遂與俱 見景駒，請兵以攻豐。

translations.literal: Pei Lord went to follow him, on the way obtained Zhang Liang, therefore together with him went to see Jing Ju, requested troops to attack Feng.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Pei went to join him. Along the way he met Zhang Liang, and together they went to see King Jing Ju to request troops for attacking Feng.

sentences.zh: 時章邯從陳，別將司馬镛將兵北定楚地，屠相，至碭。

translations.literal: At this time Zhang Han from Chen, separate general Sima Yi led troops north to pacify Chu territory, massacred Xiang, arrived at Dang.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Zhang Han was coming from Chen. His deputy general Sima Yi led troops north to pacify Chu territory, massacring the people of Xiang before reaching Dang.

sentences.zh: 東陽甯君、沛公引兵西，與戰蕭西，不利，還收兵聚留。

translations.literal: Dongyang Ning Jun, Pei Lord led troops west, fought with them west of Xiao, unfavorable, returned collected troops gathered at Liu.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Ning of Dongyang and Lord Pei led troops west and fought the enemy west of Xiao, but were defeated. They withdrew, gathered their troops, and concentrated at Liu.

sentences.zh: 二月，攻碭，三日拔之。
收碭 兵，得六千人，與故合九千人。
三月，攻下邑，拔之。
還擊豐，不下。
四月，項梁擊殺景駒、秦嘉，止薛，沛公往見之。
項梁益沛公卒五千人，五大夫將十人。
沛公 還，引兵攻豐，拔之。
雍齒奔魏。

translations.literal: In the first month, Zhang Er and others installed Zhao Xie, a descendant of the Zhao royal family, as King of Zhao. Lord Ning of Dongyang and Qin Jia installed Jing Ju as King of Chu, with his capital at Liu. Lord Pei went to join him. Along the way he met Zhang Liang, and together they went to see King Jing Ju to request troops for attacking Feng. At this time, Zhang Han was coming from Chen. His deputy general Sima Yi led troops north to pacify Chu territory, massacring the people of Xiang before reaching Dang. Lord Ning of Dongyang and Lord Pei led troops west and fought the enemy west of Xiao, but were defeated. They withdrew, gathered their troops, and concentrated at Liu.

sentences.zh: 五月，項羽拔襄城還。
項梁盡召別將。
六月，沛公如薛，與項梁共立楚懷王孫心為楚懷王。
章邯破殺魏王 咎、齊王田儋於臨濟。
七月，大霖雨。
沛公攻亢父。
章邯圍田榮於東阿。
沛公與項梁共救田榮，大破章邯東阿。
田榮歸，沛公、項羽追北，至城陽，攻屠其城。
軍濮 陽東，復與章邯戰，又破之。
章邯復振，守濮陽，環水。
沛公、項羽去攻定陶。
八月，田榮立田儋子市為齊王。
定陶未下，沛公與項羽西略地至雍丘，與秦軍戰，大敗之，斬三川守李由。
還攻外黃，外黃未下。
項梁再破秦軍，有驕色。
宋義諫，不聽。
秦益章邯兵。
九月，章邯夜銜枚擊項梁定陶，大破之，殺項梁。
時連雨自七月至九月。
沛公、項羽方攻陳留，聞梁死，士卒恐，乃與將軍呂臣引兵而東，徙懷王自盱台都彭城。
呂臣軍彭城東，項羽軍彭城西，沛公軍碭。
魏咎弟豹 自立為魏王。
後九月，懷王并呂臣、項羽軍自將之。
以沛公為碭郡長，封武安侯，將碭郡兵。
以羽為魯公，封長安侯，呂臣為司徒，其父呂青為令尹。
章邯已破項梁，以為楚地兵不足憂，乃渡河北擊趙王歇，大破之。
歇保鉅鹿城，秦將王離圍之。
趙數請救，懷王乃以宋義為上將，項羽為次將，范增為末將，北救趙。
初，懷王與諸將約，先入定關中者王之。
當是時，秦兵彊，常乘勝逐北，諸將莫利先入關。
獨羽怨秦破項 梁，奮勢，願與沛公西入關。
懷王諸老將皆曰：「項羽為人慓悍禍賊，嘗攻襄城，襄城無唣類，所過無不殘滅。
且楚數進取，前陳王、項梁皆敗，不如更遣長者扶義 而西，告諭秦父兄。
秦父兄苦其主久矣，今誠得長者往，毋侵暴，宜可下。
項羽不可遣，獨沛公素寬大長者。」
卒不許羽，而遣沛公西收陳王、項梁散卒。
乃道碭至 陽城與杠里，攻秦軍壁，破其二軍。
秦三年十月，齊將田都畔田榮，將兵助項羽救趙。
沛公攻破東郡尉於成武。
十一月，項羽殺宋義，并其兵 渡河，自立為上將軍，諸將黥布等皆屬。
十二月，沛公引兵至栗，遇剛武侯，奪其軍四千餘人，并之，與魏將皇欣、武滿軍合，攻秦軍，破之。
故齊王建孫田安下濟 北，從項羽救趙。
羽大破秦軍鉅鹿下，虜王離，走章邯。
二月，沛公從碭北攻昌邑，遇彭越。
越助攻昌邑，未下。
沛公西過高陽，酈食其為里監門，曰：「諸將過 此者多，吾視沛公大度。」
乃求見沛公。
沛公方踞床，使兩女子洗。
酈生不拜，長揖曰：「足下必欲誅無道秦，不宜踞見長者。」
於是沛公起，攝衣謝之，延上坐。
食其說沛公襲陳留。
沛公以為廣野君，以其弟商為將，將陳留兵。
三月，攻開封，未拔。
西與秦將楊熊會戰白馬，又戰曲遇東，大破之。
楊熊走之滎陽，二世使使斬 之以徇。
四月，南攻潁川，屠之。
因張良遂略韓地。
時趙別將司馬卬方欲渡河入關，沛公乃北攻平陰，絕河津。
南，戰雒陽東，軍不利，從轘轅至陽城，收軍 中馬騎。
六月，與南陽守齮戰犨東，大破之。
略南陽郡，南陽守走，保城守宛。
沛公引兵過宛西。
張良諫曰：「沛公雖欲急入關，秦兵尚眾，距險。
今不下宛，宛從 後擊，彊秦在前，此危道也。」
於是沛公乃夜引軍從他道還，偃旗幟，遲明，圍宛城三匝。
南陽守欲自剄，其舍人陳恢曰：「死未晚也。」
乃踰城見沛公，曰：「臣 聞足下約先入咸陽者王之，今足下留守宛。
宛郡縣連城數十，其吏民自以為降必死，故皆堅守乘城。
今足下盡日止攻，士死傷者必多；
引兵去宛，宛必隨足下。
足下 前則失咸陽之約，後有彊宛之患。
為足下計，莫若約降，封其守，因使止守，引其甲卒與之西。
諸城未下者，聞聲爭開門而待足下，足下通行無所累。」
沛公曰： 「善。」
七月，南陽守齮降，封為殷侯，封陳恢千戶。
引兵西，無不下者。
至丹水，高武侯鰓、襄侯王陵降。
還攻胡陽，遇番君別將梅鋗，與偕攻析、酈，皆降。
所 過毋得鹵掠，秦民喜。
遣魏人甯昌使秦。
是月章邯舉軍降項羽，羽以為雍王。
瑕丘申陽下河南。
八月，沛公攻武關，入秦。
秦相趙高恐，乃殺二世，使人來，欲約分王關中，沛公不許。
九月，趙高立二 世兄子子嬰為秦王。
子嬰誅滅趙高，遣將將兵距嶢關。
沛公欲擊之，張良曰：「秦兵尚彊，未可輕。
願先遣人益張旗幟於山上為疑兵，使酈食其、陸賈往說秦將，啗 以利。」
秦將果欲連和，沛公欲許之。
張良曰：「此獨其將欲叛，恐其士卒不從，不如因其怠懈擊之。」
沛公引兵繞嶢關，踰蕢山，擊秦軍，大破之藍田南。
遂至藍 田，又戰其北，秦兵大敗。
或說沛公曰：「秦富十倍天下，地形彊。
今聞章邯降項羽，羽號曰雍王，王關中。
即來，沛公恐不得有 此。
可急使守函谷關，毋內諸侯軍，稍徵關中兵以自益，距之。」
沛公然其計，從之。
十二月，項羽果帥諸侯兵欲西入關，關門閉。
聞沛公已定關中，羽大怒，使黥 布等攻破函谷關，遂至戲下。
沛公左司馬曹毋傷聞羽怒，欲攻沛公，使人言羽曰：「沛公欲王關中，令子嬰相，珍寶盡有之。」
欲以求封。
亞父范增說羽曰：「沛公 居山東時，貪財好色，今聞其入關，珍物無所取，婦女無所幸，此其志不小。
吾使人望其氣，皆為龍，成五色，此天子氣。
急擊之，勿失。」
於是饗士，旦日合戰。
是時，羽兵四十萬，號百萬。
沛公兵十萬，號二十萬，力不敵。
會羽季父左尹項伯素善張良，夜馳見張良，具告其實，欲與俱去，毋特俱死。
良曰：「臣為韓王送沛 公，不可不告，亡去不義。」
乃與項伯俱見沛公。
沛公與伯約為婚姻，曰：「吾入關，秋豪無所敢取，籍吏民，封府庫，待將軍。
所以守關者，備他盜也。
日夜望將 軍到，豈敢反邪！
願伯明言不敢背德。」
項伯許諾，即夜復去。
戒沛公曰：「旦日不可不早自來謝。」
項伯還，具以沛公言告羽，因曰：「沛公不先破關中兵，公巨 能入乎？
且人有大功，擊之不祥，不如因善之。」
羽許諾。
沛公旦日從百餘騎見羽鴻門，謝曰：「臣與將軍戮力攻秦，將軍戰河北，臣戰河南，不自意先入關，能破秦，與將軍復相見。
今者有小人言，令將軍與臣有隙。」
羽曰：「此沛公左司馬曹毋傷言之，不然，籍何以生此？」
羽因留沛公飲。
范增數目羽擊沛公，羽不應。
范增起，出謂項莊曰：「
君王為人不忍，汝入以劍舞，因擊沛公，殺之。
不者，汝屬且為所虜。」
莊入為壽。
壽畢，曰：「軍中無 以為樂，請以劍舞。」
因拔劍舞。
項伯亦起舞，常以身翼蔽沛公。
樊噲聞事急，直入，怒甚。
羽壯之，賜以酒。
噲因譙讓羽。
有頃，沛公起如廁，招樊噲出，置車官 屬，獨騎，與樊噲、靳彊、滕公、紀成步，從間道走軍，使張良留謝羽。
羽問：「沛公安在？」
曰：「聞將軍有意督過之，脫身去，間至軍，故使臣獻璧。」
羽受 之。
又獻玉斗范增。
增怒，撞其斗，起曰：「吾屬今為沛公虜矣！」
沛公歸數日，羽引兵西屠咸陽，殺秦降王子嬰，燒秦宮室，所過無不殘滅。
秦民大失望。
羽使人還報懷王，懷王曰：「如約。」
羽怨懷王不肯令與沛公俱西入關，而北救趙，後天下約。
乃曰：「
懷王者，吾家所立耳，非有功伐，何以得專主約！
本定天下，諸將與籍也。」
春正月，陽尊懷王為義帝，實不用其命。
二月，羽自立為西楚霸王，王梁、楚地九郡，都彭城。
背約，更立沛公為漢王，王巴、蜀、漢中四十一 縣，都南鄭。
三分關中，立秦三將：章邯為雍王，都廢丘；
司馬欣為塞王，都櫟陽；
董翳為翟王，都高奴。
楚將瑕丘申陽為河南王，都洛陽。
趙將司馬卬為殷王，都 朝歌。
當陽君英布為九江王，都六。
懷王柱國共敖為臨江王，都江陵。
番君吳芮為衡山王，都邾。
故齊王建孫田安為濟北王。
徙魏王豹為西魏王，都平陽。
徙燕王韓 廣為遼東王。
燕將臧荼為燕王，都薊。
徙齊王田市為膠東王。
齊將田都為齊王，都臨菑。
徙趙王歇為代王。
趙相張耳為常山王。
漢王怨羽之背約，欲攻之，丞相蕭何 諫，乃止。
夏四月，諸侯罷戲下，各就國。
羽使卒三萬人從漢王，楚子、諸侯人之慕從者數萬人，從杜南入蝕中。
張良辭歸韓，漢王送至褒中，因說漢王燒絕棧道，以備諸侯盜兵，亦視項羽無東意。
漢王既至南鄭，諸將及士卒皆歌謳思東歸，多道亡還者。
韓信為治粟都尉，亦亡去，蕭何追還之，因薦於漢王，曰：「
必欲爭天下，非信無可與計事者。」
於是漢王齊戒設壇場，拜信為大將軍，問以計策。
信對曰：「項羽背 約而王君王於南鄭，是遷也。
吏卒皆山東之人，日夜企而望歸，及其鋒而用之，可以有大功。
天下已定，民皆自寧，不可復用。
不如決策東向。」
因陳羽可圖三秦易 并之計。
漢王大說，遂聽信策，部署諸將。
留蕭何收巴蜀租，給軍食。
五月，漢王引兵從故道出襲雍。
雍王邯迎擊漢陳倉，雍兵敗，還走；
戰好畤，又大敗，走廢丘。
漢王遂定雍地。
東如咸陽，引兵圍雍王廢丘，而遣諸將略地。
田榮聞羽徙齊王市於膠東而立田都為齊王，大怒，以齊兵迎擊田都。
都走降楚。
六月，田榮殺田市，自立 為齊王。
時彭城在鉅野，眾萬餘人，無所屬。
榮與越將軍印，因令反梁地。
越擊殺濟北王安，榮遂并三齊之地。
燕王韓廣亦不肯徙遼東。
秋八月，臧荼殺韓廣，并其 地。
塞王欣、翟王翳皆降漢。
初，項梁立韓後公子成為韓王，張良為韓司徒。
羽以良從漢王，韓王成又無功，故不遣就國，與俱至彭 城，殺之。
及聞漢王并關中，而齊、梁畔之，羽大怒，乃以故吳令鄭昌為韓王，距漢。
令蕭公角擊彭越，越敗角兵。
時張良徇韓地，遺羽書曰：「漢欲得關中，如約 即止，不敢復東。」
羽以故無西意，而北擊齊。
九月，漢王遣將軍薛歐、王吸出武關，因王陵兵，從南陽迎太公、呂后於沛。
羽聞之，發兵距之陽夏，不得前。
二年冬十月，項羽使九江王布殺義帝於郴。
陳餘亦怨羽獨不王己，從田榮藉助兵，以擊常山王張耳。
耳敗走降漢，漢王厚遇之。
陳餘迎代王歇還趙，歇立餘為代王。
張良自韓間行歸漢，漢王以為成信侯。
漢王如陝，鎮撫關外父老。
河南王申陽降，置河南郡。
使韓太尉韓信擊韓，韓王鄭昌降。
十一月，立韓太尉信為韓王。
漢王還歸，都櫟陽，使諸將略地，拔隴西。
以萬人若一郡降者，封萬戶。
繕治河上塞。
故秦苑囿園池，令民得田之。
三月，漢王自臨晉渡河，魏王豹降，將兵從。
下河內，虜殷王卬，置河內郡。
至脩武，陳平亡楚來降。
漢 王與語，說之，使參乘，監諸將。
南渡平陰津，至洛陽，新城三老董公遮說漢王曰：「臣聞『順德者昌，逆德者亡』，『兵出無名，事故不成』。
故曰：『明其為 賊，敵乃可服。』
項羽為無道，放殺其主，天下之賊也。
夫仁不以勇，義不以力，三軍之眾為之素服，以告之諸侯，為此東伐，四海之內莫不仰德。
此三王之舉 也。」
漢王曰：「善，非夫子無所聞。」
於是漢王為義帝發喪，袒而大哭，哀臨三日。
發使告諸侯曰：「
天下共立義帝，北面事之。
今項羽放殺義帝江南，大逆無道。
寡人親為發喪，兵皆縞素。
悉發關中兵，收三河士，南浮江漢以下，願從諸侯王擊楚之殺義帝者。」
夏四月，田榮弟橫收得數萬人，立榮子廣為齊王。
羽雖聞漢東，既擊齊，欲遂破之而後擊漢，漢王以故得 劫五諸侯兵，東伐楚。
到外黃，彭越將三萬人歸漢。
漢王拜越為魏相國，令定梁地。
漢王遂入彭城，收羽美人貨賂，置酒高會。
羽聞之，令其將擊齊，而自以精兵三 萬人從魯出胡陵，至蕭，晨擊漢軍，大戰彭城靈壁東睢水上，大破漢軍，多殺士卒，睢水為之不流。
圍漢王三匝。
大風從西北起，折木發屋，揚砂石，晝晦，楚軍大 亂，而漢王得與數十騎遁去。
過沛，使人求室家，室家亦已亡，不相得。
漢王道逢孝惠、魯元，載行。
楚騎追漢王，漢王急，推墮二子。
滕公下收載，遂得脫。
審食 其從太公、呂后間行，反遇楚軍，羽常置軍中以為質。
諸侯見漢敗，皆亡去。
塞王欣、翟王翳降楚，殷王卬死。
呂后兄周呂侯將兵居下邑，漢王往從之。
稍收士卒，軍碭。
漢王西過梁地，至虞，謂謁者隨何曰：「公能說九江王布使舉兵畔楚，項王必留擊之。
得留數月，吾取天下必矣。」
隨何往說布，果使畔楚。
五月，漢王屯滎陽，蕭何發關中老弱未傅者悉詣軍。
韓信亦收兵與漢王會，兵復大振。
與楚戰滎陽南京、索間，破之。
築甬道，屬河，以取敖倉粟。
魏王豹謁歸視親疾。
至則絕河津，反為楚。
六月，漢王還櫟陽。
壬午，立太子，赦罪人。
令諸侯子在關中者皆集櫟陽為衛。
引水灌廢丘，廢丘降，章邯自殺。
雍州定，八十餘縣，置河上、渭南、中地、隴西、上郡。
令祠官祀天地四方上帝山川，以時祠之。
興關中卒乘邊塞。
關中大飢，米斛萬錢，人相食。
令民就食蜀漢。
秋八月，漢王如滎陽，謂酈食其曰：「緩頰往說魏王豹，能下之，以魏地萬戶封生。」
食其往，豹不聽。
漢王以韓信為左丞相，與曹參、灌嬰俱擊魏。
食其還，漢王問：「魏大將誰也？」
對曰：「柏直。」
王曰：「是口尚乳臭，不能當韓信。
騎將誰也？」
曰：「馮 敬。」
曰：「是秦將馮無擇子也，雖賢，不能當灌嬰。
步卒將誰也？」
曰：「項它。」
曰：「是不能當曹參。
吾無患矣。」
九月，信等虜豹，傳詣滎陽。
定魏地，置 河東、太原、上黨郡。
信使人請兵三萬人，願以北舉燕趙，東擊齊，南絕楚糧道。
漢王與之。
三年冬十月，韓信、張耳東下井陘擊趙，斬陳餘，獲趙王歇。
置常山、代郡。
甲戌晦，日有食之。
十一月癸卯晦，日有食之。
隨何既說黥布，布起兵攻楚。
楚使項聲、龍且攻布，布戰不勝。
十二月，布與隨何間行歸漢。
漢王分之兵，與俱收兵至成皋。
項羽數侵奪漢甬道，漢軍乏食，與酈食其謀橈楚權。
食其欲立六國後以樹黨，漢王刻印，將遣食其立之。
以問張良，良發八難。
漢王輟飯吐哺，曰：「豎儒幾敗乃公事！」
令趨銷印。
又問陳平，乃從其計，與平黃金四萬斤，以間疏楚君臣。
夏四月，項羽圍漢滎陽，漢王請和，割滎陽以西者為漢。
亞父勸項羽急攻滎陽，漢王患之。
陳平反間既行，羽果疑亞父。
亞父大怒而去，發病死。
五月，將軍紀信曰：「事急矣！
臣請誑楚，可以間出。」
於是陳平夜出女子東門二千餘人，楚因四面擊 之。
紀信乃乘王車，黃屋左纛，曰：「食盡，漢王降楚。」
楚皆呼萬歲，之城東觀，以故漢王得與數十騎出西門遁。
令御史大夫周苛、魏豹、樅公守滎陽。
羽見紀 信，問：「漢王安在？」
曰：「已出去矣。」
羽燒殺信。
而周苛、樅公相謂曰：「反國之王，難與守城。」
因殺魏豹。
漢王出滎陽，至成皋。
自成皋入關，收兵欲復東。
轅生說漢王曰：「漢與楚相距滎陽數歲，漢常困。
願君 王出武關，項王必引兵南走，王深壁，令滎陽成皋間且得休息。
使韓信等得輯河北趙地，連燕齊，君王乃復走滎陽。
如此，則楚所備者多，力分。
漢得休息，復與之 戰，破之必矣。」
漢王從其計，出軍宛葉間，與黥布行收兵。
羽聞漢王在宛，果引兵南，漢王堅壁不與戰。
是月，彭越渡睢，與項聲、薛公戰下邳，破殺薛公。
羽使終 公守成皋，而自東擊彭越。
漢王引兵北，擊破終公，復軍成皋。
六月，羽已破走彭越，聞漢復軍成皋，乃引兵西拔滎陽城，生得周苛。
羽謂苛：「為我將，以公為上 將軍，封三萬戶。」
周苛罵曰：「若不趨降漢，今為虜矣！
若非漢王敵也。」
羽亨周苛，并殺樅公，而虜韓王信，遂圍成皋。
漢王跳，獨與滕公共車出成皋玉門，北 渡河，宿小脩武。
自稱使者，晨馳入張耳、韓信壁，而奪之軍。
乃使張耳北收兵趙地。
秋七月，有星孛于大角。
漢王得韓信軍，復大振。
八月，臨河南鄉，軍小脩武，欲復戰。
郎中鄭忠說止漢 王，高壘深塹勿戰。
漢王聽其計，使盧綰、劉賈將卒二萬人，騎數百，渡白馬津入楚地，佐彭越燒楚積聚，復擊破楚軍燕郭西，攻下睢陽、外黃十七城。
九月，羽謂 海春侯大司馬曹咎曰：「謹守成皋。
即漢王欲挑戰，慎勿與戰，勿令得東而已。
我十五日必定梁地，復從將軍。」
羽引兵東擊彭越。
漢王使酈食其說齊王田廣，罷守兵與漢和。
四年冬十月，韓信用蒯通計，襲破齊。
齊王亨酈生，東走高密。
項羽聞韓信破齊，且欲擊楚，使龍且救齊。
漢果數挑成皋戰，楚軍不出，使人辱之數日，大司馬咎怒，渡兵汜水。
士卒半渡，漢擊之，大破楚軍，盡得楚國金玉貨賂。
大司馬咎、長史欣皆自剄汜水上。
漢王引兵渡河，復取成皋，軍廣武，就敖倉食。
羽下梁地十餘城，聞海春侯破，乃引兵還。
漢軍方圍鍾離辚於滎陽東，聞羽至，盡走險阻。
羽亦軍廣武， 與漢相守。
丁壯苦軍旅，老弱罷轉餉。
漢王、羽相與臨廣武之間而語。
羽欲與漢王獨身挑戰，漢王數羽曰：「吾始與羽俱受命懷王，曰先定關中者王之。
羽負約，王 我於蜀漢，罪一也。
羽矯殺卿子冠軍，自尊，罪二也。
羽當以救趙還報，而擅劫諸侯兵入關，罪三也。
懷王約入秦無暴掠，羽燒秦宮室，掘始皇帝冢，收私其財，罪 四也。
又彊殺秦降王子嬰，罪五也。
詐阬秦子弟新安二十萬，王其將，罪六也。
皆王諸將善地，而徙逐故主，令臣下爭畔逆，罪七也。
出逐義帝彭城，自都之，奪韓 王地，并王梁楚，多自與，罪八也。
使人陰殺義帝江南，罪九也。
夫為人臣而殺其主，殺其已降，為政不平，主約不信，天下所不容，大逆無道，罪十也。
吾以義兵 從諸侯誅殘賊，使刑餘罪人擊公，何苦乃與公挑戰！」
羽大怒，伏弩射中漢王。
漢王傷胸，乃捫足曰：「虜中吾指！」
漢王病創臥，張良彊請漢王起行勞軍，以安士 卒，毋令楚乘勝。
漢王出行軍，疾甚，因馳入成皋。
十一月，韓信與灌嬰擊破楚軍，殺楚將龍且，追至城陽，虜齊王廣。
齊相田橫自立為齊王，奔彭越。
漢立張耳為趙王。
漢王疾瘉，西入關，至櫟陽，存問父老，置酒。
梟故塞王欣頭櫟陽市。
留四日，復如軍，軍廣武。
關中兵益出，而彭越、田橫居梁地，往來苦楚兵，絕其糧食。
韓信已破齊，使人言曰：「齊邊楚，權輕，不為假王，恐不能安齊。」
漢王怒，欲攻之。
張良曰：「不如 因而立之，使自為守。」
春二月，遣張良操印，立韓信為齊王。
秋七月，立黥布為淮南王。
八月，初為算賦。
北貉、燕人來致梟騎助漢。
漢王下令：軍士不幸死者， 吏為衣衾棺斂，轉送其家。
四方歸心焉。
項羽自知少助食盡，韓信又進兵擊楚，羽患之。

漢復使侯公說羽，羽乃 與漢約，中分天下，割鴻溝以西為漢，以東為楚。
九月，歸太公、呂后，軍皆稱萬歲。
乃封侯公為平國君。
羽解而東歸。
漢王欲西歸，張良、陳平諫曰：「今漢有天 下太半，而諸侯皆附，楚兵罷食盡，此天亡之時，不因其幾而遂取之，所謂養虎自遺患也。」
漢王從之。
